citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"c214b1a7-e724-4da6-9d75-69c2dd283b32\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"Ce WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 le 2017-02-15 au Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier entre le terminal de Tsawwassen \u00e0 Vancouver, en Colombie-Britannique, et le terminal de Duke Point, \u00e0 Nanaimo, en Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Turbidit\u00e9, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence. Les appareils de mesure de la turbidit\u00e9 de l'eau, de teneur en chlorophylle et de fluorescence d\u00e9tectent la lumi\u00e8re r\u00e9fl\u00e9chie par les particules en suspension dans l'eau, engendrant une tension de sortie proportionnelle \u00e0 la turbidit\u00e9 ou la mati\u00e8re en suspension. Des facteurs d'\u00e9chelle sont utilis\u00e9s pour convertir les tensions de sortie mesur\u00e9es, en valeurs repr\u00e9sentant la concentration en chlorophylle, la fluorescence et la turbidit\u00e9 de l'eau. Il a \u00e9t\u00e9 deploy\u00e9 sur une plateforme mouill\u00e9. Les donn\u00e9es de ce d\u00e9ploiement sont archiv\u00e9es et accessibles sur l\u2019infrastructure num\u00e9rique Oceans 3.0 du R\u00e9seau Canadien des Oc\u00e9ans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualit\u00e9 et produits d\u00e9riv\u00e9s selon les conventions \u00e9tablies.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidit\u00e9, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence d\u00e9ploy\u00e9 2017-02-15\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/c214b1a7-e724-4da6-9d75-69c2dd283b32?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"c214b1a7-e724-4da6-9d75-69c2dd283b32\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Ocean Networks Canada Society\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"05\", \"08\"]}], \"abstract\": \"The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Tsawwassen terminal in Vancouver, BC and the Duke Point terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence. Turbidity, chlorophyll and fluorescence instruments detect light scattered by particles suspended in water, generating an output voltage proportional to turbidity or suspended solids. Scaling factors are used to convert the voltage readings to values representing chlorophyll concentration and turbidity. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence Deployed 2017-02-15\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"http://ckan.onc.uvic.ca/dataset/c214b1a7-e724-4da6-9d75-69c2dd283b32?local=en\"}]

          <mcc:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>The EPSG Geodetic Parameter Dataset is a structured dataset of Coordinate Reference Systems and Coordinate Transformations, accessible through this online registry (www.epsg-registry.org) or, as downloadable zip files, through IOGP's EPSG home page at www.epsg.org. The geographic coverage of the data is worldwide, but it is stressed that the dataset does not and cannot record all possible geodetic parameters in use around the world.</gco:CharacterString>

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Tsawwassen terminal in Vancouver, BC and the Duke Point terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence. Turbidity, chlorophyll and fluorescence instruments detect light scattered by particles suspended in water, generating an output voltage proportional to turbidity or suspended solids. Scaling factors are used to convert the voltage readings to values representing chlorophyll concentration and turbidity. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">Ce WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 a été déployé le 2017-02-15 au Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier entre le terminal de Tsawwassen à Vancouver, en Colombie-Britannique, et le terminal de Duke Point, à Nanaimo, en Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Turbidité, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence. Les appareils de mesure de la turbidité de l'eau, de teneur en chlorophylle et de fluorescence détectent la lumière réfléchie par les particules en suspension dans l'eau, engendrant une tension de sortie proportionnelle à la turbidité ou la matière en suspension. Des facteurs d'échelle sont utilisés pour convertir les tensions de sortie mesurées, en valeurs représentant la concentration en chlorophylle, la fluorescence et la turbidité de l'eau. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme mouillé. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>

        <mcc:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://standards.iso.org/iso/19115/resources/Codelist/cat/codelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="completed"/>
      </mri:status>

      </mri:topicCategory>

      <mmi:maintenanceNote>
        <gco:CharacterString>Previous metadata record [dataset title: English = Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence Deployed 2017-02-15, dataset title: French = Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidité, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence déployé 2017-02-15, abstract: English = The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Tsawwassen terminal in Vancouver, BC and the Duke Point terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence. Turbidity, chlorophyll and fluorescence instruments detect light scattered by particles suspended in water, generating an output voltage proportional to turbidity or suspended solids. Scaling factors are used to convert the voltage readings to values representing chlorophyll concentration and turbidity. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices., abstract: French = Ce WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 a été déployé le 2017-02-15 au Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier entre le terminal de Tsawwassen à Vancouver, en Colombie-Britannique, et le terminal de Duke Point, à Nanaimo, en Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Turbidité, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence. Les appareils de mesure de la turbidité de l'eau, de teneur en chlorophylle et de fluorescence détectent la lumière réfléchie par les particules en suspension dans l'eau, engendrant une tension de sortie proportionnelle à la turbidité ou la matière en suspension. Des facteurs d'échelle sont utilisés pour convertir les tensions de sortie mesurées, en valeurs représentant la concentration en chlorophylle, la fluorescence et la turbidité de l'eau. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme mouillé. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.] differs from current metadata record [dataset title: English = Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence Deployed 2017-02-15, dataset title: French = null, abstract: English = The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route.       <mac:scope>

            <mcc:MD_ScopeCode codeList="http://wiki.esipfed.org/index.php/ISO_19115-3_Codelists#MD_ScopeCode" codeListValue="dataset"/>
          </mcc:level>
        </mcc:MD_Scope>
      </mac:scope>
      <mac:instrument>
        <mac:MI_Instrument>
          <mac:identifier>
            <mcc:MD_Identifier>
              <mcc:authority>
                <cit:CI_Citation>
                  <cit:title>
                    <gco:CharacterString>Ocean Networks Canada Society</gco:CharacterString>
                  </cit:title>
                  <cit:onlineResource>
                    <cit:CI_OnlineResource>
                      <cit:linkage>
                        <gco:CharacterString>https://data.oceannetworks.ca/DeviceListing?DeviceId=23237</gco:CharacterString>
                      </cit:linkage>
                    </cit:CI_OnlineResource>
                  </cit:onlineResource>

              </mcc:authority>
              <mcc:code>
                <gco:CharacterString>23237</gco:CharacterString>
              </mcc:code>
              <mcc:description>
                <gco:CharacterString>Local identifier for the specific device</gco:CharacterString>
              </mcc:description>
            </mcc:MD_Identifier>
          </mac:identifier>
          <mac:type>
            <gco:CharacterString>WETLabs ECO Triplet BBFL2 scattering fluorescence sensor</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:type>
          <mac:description>
            <gco:CharacterString>A three optical-sensor instrument designed for simultaneous, multiple-sensor determination of fluorescence and turbidity from various autonomous and unattended platforms in the marine environment. The BBFL2 instrument measures backscatter (650 nm), chlorophyll and CDOM fluorescence. The BBFL2 is available with optional active anti-fouling and internal batteries for long-term deployments. It measures backscatter at 650 nm wavelength, over the range 0–5 m-1 and with a sensitivity of 0.003 m-1. Chlorophyll concentration is measured over the range 0-50 ug/l, with a sensitivity of 0.025 ug/l. CDOM is measured over the range 0-375 ppb, with a sensitivity of 0.28 ppb. The instrument is stable over a temperature range of 0-30 degC and is rated to a depth of 600 m as standard.</gco:CharacterString>
          </mac:description>
        </mac:MI_Instrument>
      </mac:instrument>
    </mac:MI_AcquisitionInformation>
  </mdb:acquisitionInformation>

name: c214b1a7-e724-4da6-9d75-69c2dd283b32
notes: The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Tsawwassen terminal in Vancouver, BC and the Duke Point terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence. Turbidity, chlorophyll and fluorescence instruments detect light scattered by particles suspended in water, generating an output voltage proportional to turbidity or suspended solids. Scaling factors are used to convert the voltage readings to values representing chlorophyll concentration and turbidity. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.

notes_translated.en: The WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 was deployed on 2017-02-15 on Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. This ferry route goes between Tsawwassen terminal in Vancouver, BC and the Duke Point terminal, Nanaimo BC. This device is a Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence. Turbidity, chlorophyll and fluorescence instruments detect light scattered by particles suspended in water, generating an output voltage proportional to turbidity or suspended solids. Scaling factors are used to convert the voltage readings to values representing chlorophyll concentration and turbidity. It was deployed on a mobile platform. Data from this deployment were archived and made available through Ocean Networks Canada's Oceans 3.0 digital infrastructure, with quality assurance and derived data products following established practices.
notes_translated.fr: Ce WET Labs ECO Triplet BBFL2 786 a été déployé le 2017-02-15 au Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route. Cette route de traversier entre le terminal de Tsawwassen à Vancouver, en Colombie-Britannique, et le terminal de Duke Point, à Nanaimo, en Colombie-Britannique. Cet instrument est un Turbidité, Chlorophylle et Fluorescence. Les appareils de mesure de la turbidité de l'eau, de teneur en chlorophylle et de fluorescence détectent la lumière réfléchie par les particules en suspension dans l'eau, engendrant une tension de sortie proportionnelle à la turbidité ou la matière en suspension. Des facteurs d'échelle sont utilisés pour convertir les tensions de sortie mesurées, en valeurs représentant la concentration en chlorophylle, la fluorescence et la turbidité de l'eau. Il a été deployé sur une plateforme mouillé. Les données de ce déploiement sont archivées et accessibles sur l’infrastructure numérique Oceans 3.0 du Réseau Canadien des Océans (ONC), avec assurance de la qualité et produits dérivés selon les conventions établies.

description_translated.en: The Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System (CIOOS) Pacific is the regional hub of the National CIOOS for ocean data aggregation on Canada’s west coast.
description_translated.fr: Le Système intégré d’observation des océans canadien (SIOOC) Pacifique est la plaque tournante régionale du SIOOC national pour l’agrégation des données océaniques sur la côte ouest du Canada.

title: Tsawwassen - Duke Point Ferry Route Turbidity, Chlorophyll and Fluorescence Deployed 2017-02-15

description.fr: Accueil des données canadiennes sur l'océan Pacifique
description.en: Home of Canada's Pacific Ocean Data

resources.description: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments

description_translated.en: Data is delivered via ERDDAP, a data server that gives a standardized way to download subsets of datasets in common file formats. This particular ERDDAP installation has oceanographic data from Ocean Networks Canada's instruments

resources.name: ERDDAP
